name: Basketball Movement Prep
setup: Have basketball and access to hoop or wall for shooting practice
Clear space for dribbling and basic movement patterns
Start at 50% intensity and gradually build
steps: Begin with stationary dribbling - right hand, left hand, alternating
Progress to walking dribbles - forward, backward, side-to-side
Add basic shooting form practice (form shots close to basket)
Include light defensive slides and direction changes
Finish with a few easy layups or close shots
cues: Start slow and focus on touch and feel
Use proper shooting form even at close range
mistakes: Starting too intense after time off
Neglecting fundamentals in favor of flashy moves
safety: Since this is your first basketball session in 2 months, prioritize movement quality over intensity. Listen to your body and don't force any movements that feel off.

regressions: Wall shooting practice instead of basket

prescriptionHints.notes: Focus on feel and fundamentals. Build intensity gradually.

joints.notes: Pay attention to ankle stability and knee tracking. Wrist comfort with ball handling.
